UNJulFc3LjVTbMni8g698w.text: This place is a great find and departure from the norm. It's a nice little establishment located fairly close to home. The food is always great and the prices are fair. The folks there are great people as well. What I also love is they have different flavored fries.   My only qualm is since I'm from the Midwest, our gyros back home are packed with so much meat that the pita has zero chance of touching the other side when being rolled up (you literally need and get a fork), so out here I'm getting about 1/3 of the meat at the same price. But if you're from here you'd never realize what you're missing out on.   One tip is to not get the fries to go unless they're dry. We got the lemon topping and it was soggy at home :(.  Overall, no question, put this place on your list.

Zh92jCv-4AqIPPXLcMM9SQ.text: Having driven out to Ballantyne to visit the proprietor's brothers Greco Fresh Grille, we are super excited that they were able to find a location to open here in Tega Cay!!!  Large menu of authentic Greek food, priced very reasonably and all made, as the name says, FRESH and delicious!  Gonna be a regular! Liquor license applied for, so beer soon available I assume. #Winning

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

RNpuLbvs5MNHkmto_gMNow.text: Fresh and tasty. Traditional salad was large and the dressing was nicely seasoned and not too oily.  The olives and feta were great  The cheese and spinach triangles were good, but the spinach was a little over cooked and there wasn't much cheese. The lamb was good and tender.  Friendly and helpful service.

9Hd5gqt9LHb9DYLtpOGREQ.text: I'm not one to leave reviews, but hands down one of the best baklava's I've ever had. The falafel pita is also delicious. You can tell all the ingredients that are used here are fresh. I've ordered from them quite a few times, but the baklava is what hit it out of the park for me.  Everything in general has been good. Can't emphasize enough the best part of the food here is that it's fresh and nothing over seasoned.

6J6puaKGDypdt1OCkbbnhA.text: I first visited Greco's a few days after they opened and I was blown away by the crowds that were already gathering. It didn't take me long to understand the reason for the immediate love that folks were showing - it's because of the great people, the FANTASTIC quality and the unique and interesting menu that you will find at Greco's.   I've since met owner Nick and his enthusiasm and desire to please his customers is so rare in this area and in these times. He and his family truly work hard to earn the business. I've eaten here at least a dozen times since they opened and the quality has been exceptional every time.   The shrimp skewer platter is awesome and I could eat a gyro every day for the next month. Nick grills the meat to order every time so it's always fresh and hot. The salads are also very crisp and fresh.   I plan on working my way through the whole menu and I look forward to visiting Greco's regularly.   It is so great to have Greco's in Fort Mill and  I recommend them highly.

HK2z6pGuuCycOEET52fGsQ.text: I've been here a few times within the last two weeks.  Not only is the food AMAZING but the employees and the owner of this place are extremely SWEET!!! I've been looking for a Greek restaurant for a while now and am SO GLAD I found this place!

iEkPLABigTSXA2DmESFUtg.text: It's really great to have a place like this nearby. It's right up the road and easy to find and the food is great. My wife and I moved here from San Francisco a number of years ago and have been waiting for great food places to open.  It looks like our wishes are finally coming True.

MHAvWKF2VapV36vYm7fcYQ.text: Good solid fresh food and hearty portions .Reasonable prices and nice variety. They owned a diner in North Jersey. Family owned . They know what they are doing .

6fV34HBOICJllpZX_ulf3A.text: We were thrilled when Greco Fresh Grille opened their new location in Fort Mill as we would regularly drive all the way to Blackney for their food!     Giving four stars instead of five as the food could use a little more salt (the food in the Blackney location tastes noticeably better), by overall the staff is welcoming and the food is still great!  My favorite part about this restaurant is that they have plenty of vegetarian options, so I don't have to order the same item on the menu each visit!  Be sure to try their baklava at least once!

ik7V2s2Q1Bv6dl6kIt0T_w.text: Excellent!! So delicious!!! I had the Greek salad, super FRESH! The dressing is wonderful!! My daughter had a chicken gyro and my husband had the beef gyro.  Both excellent!! So so happy to have excellent Greek food in Tega Cay/Fort Mill!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

y-WOyCImcUkg7aLq79uafA.text: Came here on a road trip down from Greensboro. The owner of the place took our order and was incredibly nice. I ordered the Traditional Gyro and my mom the Falafel.   The gyro was amazing. Everything you want in a lamb gyro, amazingly cooked and they did not skimp on the lamb!  The Falafel was beyond words. I've had Falafel all over the world and this somehow surpassed all of them.   The owner came over to check on us, and when we told him how amazing it was he told us the secret to making a great Falafel. All in all, amazing staff, amazing food, and amazing experience. There's no way to disappoint here.

jpTCkO14wk_ik33xbMin9w.text: Fort Mill needs good food and this one has it down.    I ordered the greek salad with a side of tzatziki sauce and added chicken.  The sauce...is ...well it is much better than mine and I am a pretty good cook.  The salad had big chunks of feta and REAL greek olives.  Was above my expectations.  I did not want to order fries but had heard they were very good.  I let Nick know I would love to taste them. but did not want a full order...he offered me a few and oh yeah... Best fries anywhere around!  He gets an A+ too for hospitality.  So glad to have this restaurant in our town.

2oR0n3eQuEN9vMt8T106Xw.text: So glad they opened in Fort Mill.   The food is great and the staff is very friendly. The salad with grilled chicken is huge and delicious. Love their gyros too. One of my favorite lunch places.

KtcjKYSMloKB9k_-vo4KRQ.text: My wife and I heard really good things about Greco's other restaurants so I decided to pick up dinner last Saturday. It was great! I got the traditional gyro and the Mrs. got the Greek salad with chicken. The meats were well seasoned, the tzatziki was home made and tasted great! Their stuffed grape leaves and hummus were really good, too. Thrilled to have another great restaurant to add to our Saturday night options! You can probably tell from the other reviewers pictures that it's more of a "counter service" place. Inside is nice, no frills. A little small. It's in a strip mall. Has outside seating. I decided not to take off any stars for the layout. It's not their fault. Food is great, that's all that matters!

OvWKDCYj2Wz_KoZ36JhCGA.text: Delicious food and friendly service! Stopped by for an early dinner today and got the chicken platter. It came with a delicious Greek salad and was plenty of food, enough to have leftovers for lunch tomorrow! John was super friendly and quick!

xnULQCAxhpOOFGw0sgDO_A.text: In my opinion,this is the best new restaurant in town. Fresh, authentic and delicious. I was so impressed that I returned the next day to sample more menu items. I'm a regular now and the food is always awesome.  The staff is very friendly, I always feel welcome and appreciated.

vyQbqEK3JDa3jN4Ggljcwg.text: Visiting from Florida for the Carolina Ragnar and we were looking for a close place to eat! This was delicious!!! The owner was so friendly and the food was exactly what we needed after a long day in the car and a long weekend ahead of running! The food was very fresh!

vV-jxv6tNb_oxEDgAAvbhg.text: Went there today and enjoyed a gyro with a side of lemon hummus. The food was flavorful, fresh and filling. The staff was friendly, which is important as well.   Whenever I wanted a gyro I had to go uptown to Little Village Grill, which is a 5 star. They prepare a great  gyro and the way they season their fries are simply delicious!   This Greek franchise ( in Fort Mill) is a clear 4 star; we've needed a nice Greek place here. I wish them them much success & we'll will be going there often.

DYsv5X9PAS-5K6TgcZjtRg.text: I don't have a lot of time to go on and on about how great this place is. It's great! The food is always very fresh and I love how the owners actually work there. The couple that runs the place is very caring that the food is always high quality. Worth trying if you like to eat healthy, fresh food.

wdne9ZdSXHR447Up5GZwDA.text: I am new to the neighborhood and was so excited that there was a local owned Mediterranean restaurant near me. I was not disappointed! The falafel was moist and flavorful. The gyro had lots of lamb and great flavor. The Greek salad was enough to share. The baklava was to die for. Seriously my new favorite Greek place.I will be back with froends.

jaBShJeku4ZJxrhpcwAWFg.text: This place lives up to the yelp hype. Delicious and fresh fast food. Smiling courteous helpful staff.   Best falafel I've had in a long while. I had a self modified Greek salad and it was great. Simple but perfectly spiced vinaigrette. Baklava is worth a calorie splurge too.  I split the generous piece with 3 people:)

00VLdG1xqrceP_0ZgPYcVg.text: I tried this place out on a Saturday evening. I ordered a grilled chicken Greek salad. When you enter the restaurant, there is a person to take your order at the counter and they give you a number. There is indoor and outdoor seating. Someone brought me my food. The salad was good but there was a lot of onions in it. The dressing was good as well. The owners were very visible. They spoke to all of the dine in customers, cleaned tables, and helped behind the counter with orders. I appreciated seeing the the owners being so visible. I ordered a gyro as a take-out. It was excellent. I will be back.

5JsYSyQMlUjzGdcd9T7-DA.text: I was disappointed to see that La Fornarina had closed recently. However, I was happy to see that Greco Fresh Grille was opening in its place. We have been going to the one in Blakeney for years.   I stopped in this new location and the owner Nick was working the register. They definitely changed the decor from the previous incarnations and it no longer feels like a Donato's, which was the original business that occupied this space. It's quick serve casual but they have a lot of options including vegetarian, salads, gyros and more. Nick was working the register and despite the place being busy, the staff was handling it. I ordered two mezze platters to go. They include a little bit of everything. The food was really good. The only negative is that I ordered the large piece of kefte (kind of like a Mediterranean meatloaf) but I received the half portion. It wasn't a huge deal because it was still good and the platters have a good amount of food anyway.  It is nice to finally have some decent Greek food in Fort Mill/Tega Cay. It's even better that it is cheap, fast and good.

vkRIe1e9EiDKMOmxg2aGhw.text: This is a nice clean place. Food is good but not great. It satisfies my gyro craving but makes me miss the Greek from Astoria , Queens.

qwXWpnzrnEjcUqY3dExcGA.text: Nick is an awesome small business owner in the restaurant industry!  I am so happy he is their to greet his customers. He is always full of energy. Im lucky Greco is so close to my work. It is the best Greek food.

kw1O3aOfFWjh931B71y8kw.text: Wow - authentic Greek food right here in Fort Mill, SC. Doesn't get better than that unless Nick (owner) was serving his food to me at a table cafe on Mykonos! I've eaten there many, many times but never bothered to leave a review so I'm hoping to make up for that now. When weather permits, you can eat outside. The food is fresh, great tasting, generous serving sizes and there's quite a variety available + cold beverages, including beer. Yesterday they catered a lunch at our development and it was a real hit. A great place for a quick meal. I love the Greek salad with grilled chicken, pita bread & hummus (several flavors available) with either iced tea or a cold beer. Yum, yum!

fDzrzbeCmiO_o_bKNDItNQ.text: Whenever I have to go to Charlotte for work, I always plan on stopping at Tega Cay for Greco Fresh! It's a few extra minutes drive from I-77 but worth the time. Fresh delicious food, excellent, freshly prepared salads and gyros (really good vegetarian gyro!), and wonderful service. Order at the counter and they bring it to your table. It's very clean and has clean restrooms too. Don't forget the baklava! Take it to go if you don't have room for dessert!!

gwEwMC_Bh-1WAiuMYOVo9A.text: It's nice to find a place that will make your order the way you want. Everything I get has to be changed in someway (just a picky eater) but the staff here does so and always with a smile. The owner always engages me when he takes my order and really makes you feel good about your day. If that wasn't enough, the food is terrific. Good home style Greek favorites. Cooked just right with the perfect amount of seasoning. I highly recommend them for Lunch and dinner.

di2cx73oGbiKGEnWCs-jIQ.text: Really good food and generous portions. Attentive service and good family spot for quick meal.   Will def be back.

JlTy2ptwIhpa0DcS6ptwQA.text: My husband and I have been looking for a Mediterranean place in the area and I am so happy we gave this place a try!!! I had a Greek chicken salad and my husband had the Greek salad with gyro meat. Both were awesome. Everything tasted fresh and delicious! Very friendly staff and they checked on us throughout our meal. We will definitely be back!

FzA9c9bcL0noZ0b52UgK2w.text: Greco is our go-to place when we need a great salad and a glass of wine. The food is great (salad's, Gyro's and platter) and the atmosphere is nice. Overall a great place with food that is much better than Shomars and Zoes Kitchen in Rivergate.

qpntI5WSx5simyw_FyX5ag.text: You have to try their food! Absolutely delicious! Ive had their salmon, shrimp, chicken, lamb, and even vegetarian dishes. All perfectly seasoned!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

cQ2KD1ZaixHRhVNm6LGtWQ.text: Excellent service and delicious food. I went there and had the classic gyro all the way and a order of Baklava. Had a nice time speaking with the manager and shared some stories. Really excellent place, highly recommend it!

VO_TcTJTYNrzKWgPCga-bw.text: I am a creature of habit and always get the same thing, the fresh Greek salad with chicken breast. It's so healthy, refreshing and delicious. I probably get it once a week. I love this place. It's clean and the people who run it are nice. I will keep coming back.

XE58crtuYc8aF9g4zuThNA.text: Even though its not fancy I'm giving this place 5 stars because everything is fresh and done perfectly each time. It's also cheap and very clean. Yes it's not fancy but, so what? It's great, simple Greek food. What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The line. You know it&#39;s good!
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Half greek with falafel added. So cheap sooo delicious!!!

MAcd7DfoJ9aFh_bWXmp5Aw.text: Absolutely delicious. The service was great and the portion sizes were very generous. This place is a must try and we will definitely be back.

LKXFwkl99mvhbXia0i54qw.text: Was in the fort mill area and was looking for restaurants for lunch.  I am sucker for Mediterranean food,  and found Greco to be minutes away from where we were.  So, let's try it!! Ordered Chicken Gyro, Grilled Chicken Kebobs and the devilishly deliciously looking Baklava that was just then refilled on the front counter.  Got our number card, found a table around the corner and the wait starts.  Either our food was late or we were so hungry even minutes felt like hours, lol.  Well, the restaurant was crowded so can't complain on the way, but we were hungry too. My chicken gyro was delicious, just awesome, enjoyed every bite of it.  The tzatziki sauce was just delicious and fresh, chicken was perfectly cooked and spices was just on point. Grilled chicken kebobs was only OK, not great.  Agreed its kebobs, its usually dry but ours was dry and a little hard as well.  The rice that was chosen as a side was very bland no spices or herbs which would enhance rice's flavor.  For 11 bucks we were expecting a better tasting chicken kebobs. Finale - Baklava. That's it.  Everything was forgiven. That was one big, flaky, nutty, warm, sweetttttttt, super delicious baklava we ever had. LOVED IT.

MWXpUbYxzAvNzxvQ7xzhRQ.text: Amazing customer service and food. I think the chicken group was better than the salmon one. The fries were wonderful and multiple seasoning options!!!   The man, who I think was the owner was super kind and friendly. Will definitely be back !

1IZkzjuvAQbl9-ix0Zgp3w.text: My husband had the veggie pita and added shrimp. It was very filling and fresh.  I had the traditional pita with a side salad. Everything was custom made to order and the service was the best I've had in a long time.

awZidMC5TgJgoN7BFI_9Ag.text: Very good healthy alternative for here in Tega Cay. Lots of flavor and the hummus is on point.   The fries... oh my goodness the fries :)

-AbtME1HOc-0qNlTC8SCJQ.text: Been here ten times already. Great food. Great service. Great owners. Chicken on point. Gyro amazing. Falafel to die for and the tzatziki you will want extra of. So glad great food has arrived to fort mill.

g13_DA00La_CbedWnzr9cA.text: Food was good. Owner was super friendly. Great service and atmosphere. I would highly recommend visiting this resturant.  The giro was great! Salad was great!

93udu6sR7r8mShe__JpNbg.text: Got the chicken platter with cumin garlic fries; added pita bread with chipotle garlic hummus.  Everything was excellent.  The staff was friendly and smiling despite a line out the door. I'll be back.

0gayExyPedNxs0HOiCFPtg.text: The Good: it is close and predominantly fresh.   The dolmades and spanakopita are both solid efforts.   The rest is unfortunately bland.  The chicken platter is sliced dry chicken - I'm hoping the kebab is better.   The rice pilaf lacks the saffron or normal Greek seasoning.  The hummus is good but could use more tahini - also slightly dry and lacking good flavor.   I'd come again but I hope the other offerings improve my impression of the place - otherwise convenient Greek food is its best angle.  Jasmine and Mad Greek on South Blvd and Zeoutoni in Ballentyne all offer far superior Greek food.

DqUyGtzyuq9BZWfHG38GYg.text: We have been to this restaurant a couple of times, both before and after the name change. Food has always been excellent and prices are decent. What really makes this place special, in addition to the great food, are the owners! They are always present and more often than not can be seen chatting with customers and giving extra special attention to the children. The staff all seem to actually enjoy working there, which in and of itself, speaks volumes! My family of 4 loves dining here when we are in the mood for some good Greek food. We will be back soon!

DfWeuPxpLTAwDtuRQZn9zw.text: I've been the other locations but I'm glad this one opened up because it's close to my work. We got several items here to go and we were all pleased! I was surprised at how the presentations looked in the to go boxes. It was all a nice touch.   I got the shrimp kabobs with rice. I couldn't believe how much rice they gave me. Shrimp was delicious and tender. Several people for the chicken gyro and loved it. Two people got salads with salmon on it and thought the salmon was cooked well.   Can't wait to come back! Prices are also very reasonable!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Grilled salmon salad
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken gyro and hummus
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken gyro and fries

G3Lp9GEp_WKkI32LDfDqBA.text: Nicely decorated, bright place.  You pay at the counter, they bring food to the table, real flatware and dishes (no disposables). Friendly service but not super fast.  I tried the mezze platter, hubby ordered the traditional giro and Greek salad, all freshly made, perfect for Summer.  Butter cookies, delicious and fresh. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Delicious summer fare, clean nicely decorated place, friendly service.  Will return.
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Patio outdoor dining
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

pK3sVT7ASmmw2FwJDTO5UQ.text: I've been to this place twice now and I'm super indifferent. First I had the traditional gyro and the lemon oregano fries. Solid lunch on a Friday. I returned last week for a lamb special platter which included, 5-6 small strips of lamb (gyro), a side Greek salad, rice pilaf and warm pita bread. For a price tag of almost $12 I do not feel the portions are substantial for dinner, although the food is quite tasty and authentic. I will probably return as it is in my neighborhood but when I'm looking for a more hearty meal, I may drive a little further out for a similar cuisine.

JMZnU_mbb5Xgh4PKyOU7_g.text: There is not a lot of Mediterranean places around here so it's great to have them here. I love falafels and they are pretty good, I do enjoy getting the falafel wrap. I am not a huge fan of their hummus though something about the texture of their hummus is different than any others that I have tasted. I'm not saying it is bad just not my favorite. They have a lot of good options there with reasonable prices. We usually get take out, but it seems clean inside when we go to pick it up. A good go to spot for some good Mediterranean food.

YHTvKobHdia7I0K0XeZGzw.text: Nice experience at Greco.  Spent some time talking to the owner, super friendly!  The Gyro was great and their home made Taziki sauce is top shelf!

M41R-juDecPevd4Yw7JrUg.text: This is hands down one of my fave mom and pop shops! The service is outstanding and the food is absolutely delicious. I always tend to get the lamb gyro or shrimp gyro and both are amazing! The gyro is so fluffy and fresh and the fries are to die for.

AcWPTKf7tC-wfn9cv6No5Q.text: Great Greek food with a great price point! Don't ever choose Shomars over this place. I've pretty much tried every pita and have never been disappointed. I was surprised how juicy and flavorful their gyro was--not dry at all. The same can be said about their chicken and salmon. I honestly think their shrimp is much better than some seafood restaurants. I've gone to many places where the shrimp was over cooked and rubbery, but that is not the case here. Their portion sizes are pretty big, and their small fries can feed 2-3 people. Come hungry or you'll be leaving with leftovers.   Not to mention, their staff is friendlu and really helpful if you don't know what to get. John suggested for me to try several new dishes and I was happy with what I got!

k29JQ7UgO0ZC7200uNJz8Q.text: An outrageously good, and fresh take on Greek goodies with fries that either rival or beat Five Guys. Had the traditional gyro and it was absolutely amazing. If you enjoy Greek food, please check this place out. You won't be let down.

qD4DEiSGbPLfOqla9DtoOw.text: Fantastic food. Always fresh and tasty. Really good desserts too. Especially the cheesecake baklava.

oXanVdJ-hQ-zvl75RKrG7A.text: Outstanding food at a good price. I've tried it all- everything is good. I recommend the chicken, lamb, or kefte gyro. The fries are delicious.  If you have any questions or concerns John will be more than happy to help you out.

Guhpnu4zgK4LhdZ6advUfA.text: Very good! My husband and I both got pita sandwiches, he had gyro and I had the kefte (ground beef) both were excellent. Fresh tasting. Made to order and was quick. My son loved the pita pizza and it was pretty inexpensive. We also got the grape leaves. I'd definitely go back. Very good food and a good value!

9pyJ9LLFibUs1ILD5Me7fg.text: The best Greek salad ever. The freshest salad I've had. Always good. Love the outdoor seating. Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

dQSEItmRUwBgU62ZveDhTA.text: We stumbled on this place while running errands and we got so lucky! This place hit the spot. The fries were hand cut and perfect. The chicken souvlaki was seasoned perfectly and so flavorful. The protein bowl was more than enough food- well worth it! My husband loved his lamb gyro and the falafel was some of the best Ive ever had... same with the hummus which was clearly made in house. The staff were friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. I can't wait to go back.

UgOobWXdyT7SfRKUL_UWXQ.text: Love this place! Good healthy choices at good prices and nice fast service. Nick the owner is always so friendly and knows his regulars!

KilRCk91zCTgTqQgOMiZSA.text: Convenient location to meet Charlotte family off of 77. Food is fresh and delicious! Staff is very friendly. Loved the hummus, fries, chicken kebabs, etc. We will be back!

276AqKsl0-b9x0knq5nwiw.text: First, let me start by saying the service was great! The owner stepped out from behind the counter to go over the menu with us and made sure we were satisfied until we walked out the door.  The chicken gyro and kefte platter was really tasty. However, the rice could use more seasoning. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

c4iDqhFdgWl_nJjxLijI1w.text: Great food, very tasty and fresh. I met the owner, extremely personable and authentic. We ordered take out, two gyros and fries. I will be back to try something new next time. This is the perfect fix to get something quick on a hot pool day!

cNPbqnqi0i072cKdQhEtaQ.text: Really dry chicken in the gyro, not enough sauce. The Greek salad wasn't good - not fresh & only 2 olives in the whole salad. Sadly, there are better Greek salads at local non-Greek restaurants.

BS9iZRfAFV_tUU-Zv3u23w.text: Really great service and delicious food! I got the chicken skewers and the fried honey balls (they were AMAZING!). Definitely going to come back and recommend this place to friends!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken Skewers Platter (I ate a few pieces of the chicken before I took the pic)

LpKKlF_OcwKbsrnKwP49RQ.text: Holy tzatziki, The Greek Grill is so great! Everything I've tried here has been wonderful. The mezze platter is a fabulous way to get a taste of some of the specialties. The falafel pita is delicious. The Greek fries are a must. And the desserts.... The galaktompoureko is insanely good. I want to try the katalfi next time!

fs51ZK3lNEjCNvugSeM0yA.text: I really enjoyed my lunch here. Nice clean restaurant with friendly staff. The food came out hot and fresh. I had the gyro platter with Greek fries and salad. It was delicious. The baklava was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Gyro Platter

rDsH4IpHITqDK5ZF6UB27w.text: We didn't have a great experience here. When I think Greek food I expect really flavorful, fresh food. Our food just seem bland and dry and the fries were absolutely swimming in grease. My salad didn't even have olives which I thought was strange.   The worst part of the visit was that the whole place smelled like grease. I don't know if that's always the case, or if they were having trouble with their fryer, but it was unpleasant. We all reeked when we left.   The best part of our visit was the cashier. She was so very friendly and helpful.

-V1Agk64x82erzTaKUpC4g.text: Best Greek food I ever had. The lamb gyro is to die for!!! And fries are FRESH. Friendly owners/staff and great atmosphere.

pFUY5nH-q0i9jdeC2n-wnw.text: Stopped here for a quick bite to eat while apartment hunting in the area and WOW!!! The best gyro I've had in a long time. Definitely gives a plus to the surrounding apartments in the area. Staff is great and friendly will definitely be coming back soon!

WqziAPQRA1r3lWYr4oa57A.text: This place is a hidden gem well worth the trip from Rock Hill to enjoy. The food is authentic and delicious and what stood out immediately was the hand cut fries. They have several options but I had the cumin and garlic and let me tell you it's amazing. So good!!!

cYd9DEkaCnYzBlHyf4EcHA.text: The Greek Grill is my favorite place to eat having many vegetarian  options available. Always clean, best food and service with a smile. Owners are working on site 99.9% of the time. My favorites are a large Greek salad with a side of sea salt fries finished off with a extra large piece of homemade baklava. Thank you all for taking such good care of your customers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Nice key chain.....The Greek Grill.....always on my mind!
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Side of sea salt french fries and a large Greek salad.
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Great big piece of baklava, enough for two but I always eat it all.

GFK6-ATZ-DCP1sVLNzgvFg.text: My favorite Greek place in the area!! Super friendly and kind people working there! The owners are lovely and are there working making it feel like home! Oh did I mention the food it sooooo good! They have different types of homemade hummus and yummy fries with different spices! Their spanakopita is yummy :)

KvgdZZ_hxIdQZVj6cF_3Ig.text: Seriously delicious! This is a great place to get authentic Greek food. I suggest getting it to go if you can because the dining area is very basic and there is not much room. The staff is very friendly and willing to go the extra mile though. It's worth checking out!

aV6RyZsZr77uGpUgSI-kFw.text: My family and I were driving down to Florida and stopped to see an ante and uncle in SC. Turns out they have an amazing Greek restaurant called the The Greek Grill. The food is very good and met all expectations. Also the dessert was delicious! Thanks you Theo and Thea!

Xj36Pi8u4RSZAM47HLMSaw.text: Amazing, healthy food, low prices, friendly owners and employees. Hard to beat it, I eat here multiple times a week.

P8H9a0ykDUMBBxk8OHuYig.text: This place is a must try. The food and service are excellent every trip. We brought our dog with us today to sit outside and the staff immediately brought a water bowl and some treats for her. They are very pet friendly so that is a big plus! We always get the gyros and they never disappoint. I like these better than Showmars and that is saying something. As for sides, the lemon oregano fries are stellar as well as the loukamades.   If you haven't been you must stop here to try it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

tvuMQy7x766P4HqtBxrPJg.text: Best fries in town! Love the couple running the place because they make you feel like you're visiting their home.

AHE_ASVKyNgQyK8LoTscIw.text: Counter service establishment. Does really good gyros. I'm a sucker for fresh cut fries and they do them well. I've taken many people here and none of them were disappointed. The owner is there often and is very accommodating. If you like green food i highly recommend checking them out.

VtZxTz5yNSjMsL_3CEi4_Q.text: I have to say I'm SUPER happy we found this little Greek spot. I have been itching to get Greek since we moved here. I have tried one other place then found Greco Fresh.  There was 6 people in my party and we all got something different. Everyone enjoyed their food, not complaints at all. I had the Chicken Gyro which was scrumptious. The pita was perfect and the tzatziki was probably my favorite. We got the tzatziki appetizer... probably not good for my diet but well worth it.   The staff was amazing and really friendly. The lady working behind the counter came over and chatted with us for a bit. She was so sweet and made sure we had everything we needed. The owners weren't there because they are in Greece. The restaurant was really laid back and clean. Nice place to stop in with the family.   I will absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. View from my seat. Front counter and store sign.
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Drink station
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Some nice tables and my daughter! Look how clean and bright it is!

AHA8abb-VFTMAy7shNesVw.text: Such fresh and authentic Greek food.  I am so glad I stumbled upon this little gem.  Always have awesome service and homemade recipes!  Love love love this place!!

XQXHf1zuN9rDGUC2FNmwDg.text: Love this little Greek spot.  Most days you'll find the owner, Nick, running the register.  Nick is super friendly and always generates a conversation with his customers.  Actually the entire customer experience is great as everyone here is really nice.   The food is consistently great.  I have tried several items, but my go to is the Mezze Platter which includes spinach pies, dolmades, tzatziki, feta, olives, hummus, cucumbers and pita.  Only $8.95 for all this!!  For the gluten allergy people, any sandwich on the menu can be made into a lettuce wrap.  Also pita pizza, burger or chicken fingers for the little ones that may not like the regular menu.   This place easily gets and deserves 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Mezze Platter - spanakopita, dolmades, hummus, Pita, tzatziki, cucumbers, feta and olives.  Delicious!!

Kp4PM0KxF0eGna2lH5IOww.text: My family and I love it here! Their portions are large and super fresh & delicious food. Their service is fantastic-the owners are always very welcoming & ask if there's anything else that you'd like or need to make it a great experience. Try their protein bowl, soooo yummy!

pOxnKU4HpeEz5hWUDF3O1A.text: Great lunch spot and delicious food! You place your order at the counter and are given a number. The friendly staff then brings your order to your table. My wife and I stopped there for a quick bite and ordered the Lamb Gyro combo and Greek Salad. The Gyro was made perfectly with fresh pita bread and came with French Fries. The fries were hot and fresh with just the right crunch. The salad was a traditional Greek with just the right amount of dressing and feta cheese. The staff came by a couple of times to check on us. They were very attentive and had smiles on their faces - something you don't see a lot at places anymore! We will be back soon!

v8gIN-9YuNAqBkB6MPY8Ug.text: I probably eat here once a week, I always say I'm going to try something new but end up with a large Greek salad with grilled chicken and extra feta cheese. I can't help it. Very good food and the gyros are delicious as well. Can't go wrong here and the owner is a nice guy.

wpb3E9mkESqy1qxQSQEEIw.text: The "fast casual" applies well here.  The owners & employees are all great, and very helpful.  Overheard someone else trying to eat low-carb, and someone who I think was the owner recommended a combination of things not on the official menu.  Even though they were busy on a Sunday afternoon, he was more than willing to go the extra mile.    The food was great.  I had a combination of lamb & chicken on a salad that was excellent.  Everyone was happy, and they had sufficient variety.  I do somewhat wish they had more seating, but growth may mean less personal service.  Definitely a good local business to support!

zSHTAAdB_7WiJ53RcjPKtA.text: If you're special needs or your children are DO NOT COME HEEE! The owners son will yell at your special needs children and lecture you about controlling your children in front of customers.  Update (20 minutes later): I just received a private message on yelp from an employee of the restaurant claiming I could be sued for slander. Trey Y. Then tried to down vote my review of the restaurant.  To clarify from Trey's attack. I am not the father and I was not in the family that was accosted in front of us. I was with the group of gentleman in line behind them.  It  is positively deplorable for any business to behave in this manner.  In response to the owner:  The Greek Grill - SC that is not the way things happened. This is merely spin control for the horrible behavior of your son. Your son was rude and accosted the family before the child stepped into the aide counter area NOT BEHIND THE COUNTER. YOUR SON LECTURED AN ENTIRE FAMILY IN FRONT OF MY PARTNER AND FRIENDS AS WELL AS OTHER PATRONS.   As you continue with the lies and propaganda. Trey may not work for you as you say, either that or he does not exist and it was your son or somebody else messaging me directly because there were no male patrons aside from my group and the family that was attacked by your son. Justifying your sons atrocious behavior is not an apology. Further more I don't deserve the apology. The special needs girl in the parking lot crying because they had to leave does.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Conversation with Trey.

dpl-bvTWXIa2ygRHkzu2qg.text: Not only is the food here incredibly delicious, but the warm and welcoming customer service by the entire staff including the owner himself is amazing!   I would honestly return just on the friendliness of the employees and the owner. The great food is a bonus! The lamb gyro was so tender and delicious I could have easily eaten two of them! Their hand-cut fries are perfection and FYI they're big enough to share.   Thanks Nick! We'll be back!   "Panama"

0FbRED6pXFH3UZJlBNboPQ.text: I've been meaning to try the Greek grill for a while now. When I entered I was greeted by a nice man, (may be the owner)and he walked me through my menu options. Super friendly and accommodating.  I ordered a few items to go and the food was prepared quickly.  The gyro I ordered was good and it came with fries that were also seasoned nicely. My wife enjoyed her  Falafel that was prepared in a lettuce wrap. Her fries were also very good . We will come back to try other menu items for sure

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Logo

yDwHJNzNjYzYk95azmYIcw.text: We had been coming here once a week for some time as we liked the food there. However the service is hit or miss. Tonight we came in and the owner was at the only register talking to a couple for over 5 minutes about Greece, where to visit, his house on the Southern Island and he just got back a week ago. My family walked out. Not sure if the family behind me stayed or left as they were frustrated as well. Employees behind the counter could tell we were getting pissed.   Week prior the place was full and young kid running the show was all over the place apologizing for the wait. This week it's was dead and owner takes up peoples time and becomes a tour guide. Not going back.

u5TczHBdtuiSuMLw7VLdUQ.text: Just updating my review because of new ownership/name change.  This place still offers the same menu and more as when they were Greco.  Love their traditional Greek gyros and Greek salads with lamb added.  Great flavor and spice.  The only con....are the fries.  I said it in my original review, they are just okay - they are good fries, but okay in the fact of the seasoned fries, if you told me they were seasoned with cumin/garlic, lemon, etc. I would never know.  Just bland seasoning.  Still look forward to going back whenever we are in the mood for some great Greek food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. To go lamb gyros and fries

JcvCHyHMIkMSLuc9SNRncg.text: Simply great, authentic Greek Mediterranean food. Everyone here is super helpful, friendly. The authenticity, quality and flavors of the food served here is definitely on point! Great tasting, generously portioned and fairly priced. What more could you possibly want? Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken Kebabs with Lemon, Oregano Fries

vHHcf2zZuSP0DiXpIvtT2Q.text: The staff was friendly and great, the restaurant was clean and very well put together. I wanted to love the gyro but I can't get over the prepackaged pita bread and the frozen meat. If a Mediterranean restaurant is going to make gyros please have the courtesy to make them the traditional way and don't use frozen meat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Traditional gyro

E8XERb8_amEgf67X1upNwA.text: Been meaning to try the Greek Grill for quite a while. Finally got the chance to go last night. We were greeted by the owners who were so welcoming and walked us through all of the available options. The spinach pie with  Greek salad was delicious and the portion size was huge. My husband had the gyro that he said was one of the best he's had and my MIL ordered the flounder which she said was really tasty and delicious. We shared an order of fries that were soooooooo good. Everything is fresh and homemade. They brought the food promptly and checked on us often. We got several homemade desserts to go and they were all amazing and the portion size was generous. We will be going back there often! We loved the homemade food and down home style of service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Gyro with Greek salad.
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Flounder with rice, Greek salad and pita.
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Spinach pie with Greek salad and pita.

7OPRmWix0jv7EH9Ey8TIfA.text: They have the BEST gyro, and their seasoned fries are good too. We always enjoy our meals and experience here. Good options for kids too. Indoor and outdoor seating.

ANFZSxVLbQ8VkbUnUhGs0g.text: This is a good place for a quick meal. The food is reliably good. My favorite is the traditional gyro with lemon oregano fries. You can also switch out the pita for a lettuce wrap, which I have done and enjoyed. My family regularly orders the salmon pita, Greek salad, and chicken kabobs. There are options of flavors available for hummus (and fries!). I've tried both the rice pilaf and chickpea salad, and I would not order those again.   The restaurant is clean, and there is seating available outside. All of the workers are all very nice. Parking is rarely an issue.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Salmon pita with cumin garlic fries
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Traditional Gyro with Lemon Oregano Fries

RFJi67rbZy7h5iRpvV7JnQ.text: Stumbled across this place after a massage and decided to stop for a late lunch. Ordered the lamb gyro, hand cut fries, and garlic hummus with pita points. We decided to sit outside and the food came quickly. The portion sizes were very generous. The hummus was flavorful and fresh. The gyro was definitely had a large portion of lamb, I ordered mine without tomato, and could barely finish it. The fries were made to order, had great flavor, were salted just right, and weren't too greasy. Definitely a good little find!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Lamb gyro and fries
Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Garlic hummus

8t9VWmnC9oKRDuXni9Qllw.text: We love the food. Always good. Consistent. Both Nick and his wife were friendly and welcoming. So is their son. I will always make this my first choice for food in the Lake Wylie/Steele Creek area.

AiL9S32Lr2m2hK0vuVP9-A.text: i ordered from this establishment as a part of a group that placed a lunch order through door dash. my fries were well over done, essentially burned and cold. the chicken kebab was also over done and cold. we also called to request additional tzatziki sauce, which was also left out of the order.  i can't speak regarding dining in perhaps that was the rating is so high but i definitely would not recommend ordering out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. This is the order i recvd from The Greek Grill

hIYUbumcF71GoWbTV75_5w.text: Really enjoyed lunch here with my 1/2 salad and full order of Kofta! So delicious and the service was fast and great. Got a side of Tzatziki sauce

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

9nHqCeVaYuZAa28sKyeOYQ.text: Awful. I would prefer a chain restaurant like Daphne's or Sontorini Grill over this, and as someone who is actually Greek and prefers authentic meals, that says something. The lamb platter looked more like a platter of fries with a side of meat soaked in grease. When I picked the meat up with a fork, I would have to wait for the grease to stop dripping before I could eat it. As for the portion, 4 tiny pieces of meat (pic included). Lastly, the fries were substantially undercooked. I was excited to try a new Greek place and decided on The Greek Grill based on the reviews, but I wish we had gone somewhere else. Maybe dining-in receives better attention to portion and quality than to go orders. 1 star for not having to wait for the order upon arrival.

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Lamb platter (or fry platter with a side of lamb...)

hMbt0T-rONMPvi6uvJ3v8Q.text: I really enjoyed my food. I order a protein bowl with salmon. Very filling. I needed a to go box. The cashier was extremely nice and attentive. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Protein bowl- Salmon

IEFgdVFyYcU5eHd2PVIDpQ.text: The food is consistantly good quality and fast service. The menu options are good and change on occasion. The place is often busy but can get in and out very quickly. The prices are a bit on the high side for my taste, so I limit my visits.  Still an occasional lunch stop, and will visit again.

glnhcXXoU_qKq6_qErmaAA.text: Authentic Greek food with excellent customer service. More of a fast-casual restaurant, but the food was amazing. Grab a baklava on the way out!

BMasJhCMbxflEOGSezrvAg.text: One of my favorite places in Fort Mill. The food is always consistently good, and out of the dozens of times I've been here I've never had a single bad experience. I recommend the standard gyro with spinach triangles on the side, you can't go wrong with that.

MAuY6Vx4RcN7uOerIQS_Jw.text: The Greek dishes at this restaurant is on point! The prices are really reasonable for the amount of food they give you, with friendly and welcoming staff.  Will definitely stop by whenever I'm in the area!

MYJJJeJKHFfmIHP-WJIS2Q.text: Food is good but they tend to mess up the order. So make sure, you double check your order or you will end up with a $17 bill for lunch.

0QDu6ErbJWtvODlNT6WtkQ.text: Food was good. Outside seating is not well planned. Blocked the entrance to the restaurant. Inside the restaurant you can't breathe for the cooking smoke. Really need a better exhaust system for kitchen.

b3hoFFdKFmEUcH7zKWlUlA.text: The falafel us pretty good. A little too much tzaki, but still good. The fries 6 to very well with it, though. The deserts are fantastic!

izhLfkBG28aV09GruZmExw.text: Fantastic food!! The food is so fresh. Crisp greens, AMAZING gyros!! Falafel is on point son!! Make sure you get a fresh slab of baklava. Prices are amazing, staff and owners are Incredible.

Lg2pwHENizM0VK__Bi7Lvw.text: This place is new to the area, and has already become a favorite lunch spot! Although you can't go wrong with the traditional gyro, I have ventured on to other things on the menu and love it all! Although, I do wish they had tabbouleh! Also, the service is great, and fast despite the well deserved long lines at lunch.

c9C3qNV6Bv1CBnhQaDX2Tg.text: Good gyros and  great galaktopoureko! Staff is really friendly and made for a great experience.

lXMNx0xXvoHP0M_Q3P7pgg.text: Great little things place. Quick service and pretty full menu options. The humus was delicious and they sell containers of it for take out. Very friendly staff and warm environment. Greek salad and gyros are great too.

hgIUtQxWV04P5RuvaS-nEA.text: This restaurant has a VERY family feel. From the second you walk in to the second you leave this spot will be a great experience. They're quick, and efficient, and the food is not sloppy. Prices are reasonable. I tried the falafel there today and Good Gosh it was to die for. Try the lemon zest hummus, and the lemon oregano fries are amazing. YUM!!!! You cant beat the prices for fresh quick REAL Greek food. The manager Nick came up to check on us, he is a very humble guy. Glad to see a great business being successful. Cant wait to go back.

iONuhD2NZZZiSdgjHj2XDw.text: Just got take out there for first time and it was sooo good!! Im pretty sure it was the owner who took our order and he was super friendly and helpful.  He described the two hummus flavors in detail to help me decide.  I had the vegetarian gyro and I was so excited to see the option for a whole wheat pita!!  my friend had the chicken gyro and She even had chicken leftover after the gyro was gone so they definitely don't skimp.  So delicious.  Will be back often. :)

f1Xa8y6uB20qDRTB7x8omw.text: I love Greco Fresh Grille! I work near there Blakeney location and eat there regularly. The food is always great and the staff is always nice. They are super fast too which is really helpful when you don't have a lot of time for lunch.

v9dLAJeaHUsxJCfc9eybuA.text: This is not the place you go to if you don't like salt. Everything is salted to heavy. Food portions are small for me also. Seating area is very small and very bare. And don't forget to take your clothes to the cleaners. The grease smell is everywhere. Been there twice to give it a second chance. No more.

ylL_uGjImWXOqC921o9vyw.text: Great food, don't waste anymore time looking for good Greek food. It is right here!!! Great service and customer care.

IlJxHOQVJWAjPZqipacsQw.text: Really good food, really good service!! We have always ordered the gyros.  We have liked them all.  The kids meals are great too.

IEe8l5DsUBAsl_ZwHXaHyQ.text: This was my first time here- tried the veggie pita and lemon oregano fries. Fries were soggy and pita was full of watery liquid. This place has great reviews so I'm guessing others have had better luck than I did with their choices, but based on this experience I wouldn't go back.

t20w5EPD8prvgMzn8vYZqQ.text: I love that Fort Mill has the option of Greek food! The owner of Greco and his wife are friendly and attentive. Greco Grille provides good food- I especially like the freshness of their Greek salads and their gyro meat. While dine-in, portions are generous. I sometimes get a Greek salad to go, and am disappointed with the portion sizes for the money. That's the only reason for 4 stars vs 5 stars.

cEzDVnM7xnoFKJUyra8zuw.text: My wife heard about this place opening recently and being lovers of all things Gyro we gave it a shot over the Holidays. It was awesome! Friendly staff and great fresh made hummus, salads, etc....All for a fair price. The lemon dill hummus and Parmesan oregano fries were excellent. So much so, we ended up going back three days later to try a few more selections. Better still our boys loved it, too, so now we have a new family dinning venue right around the corner.

QWl0Y0C6kQi5M-FEz5lweQ.text: This place is awesome.  Super fresh - authentic food.  Imagine that!!  Owner is wonderful!

oiA_Lut0FD_3c2lpmqPoZA.text: We tried this a few nights ago and had reasonable expectations since they had just opened.   We ordered the Tzatziki Appetizer Dip, lamb platter and the traditional gyro  plate. Food was amazing! Portions are generous but not to much.  Fresh! And delicious. Service was friendly and exceeded our expectations.   Felt like they had been open for years and not a mere 3 days!  We will definitely return often.

1DpqNR6favbBUokW_LCrPA.text: The service was good and the food was fantastic.  I had the gyro platter and would strongly recommend!

auH8THHu0l_ZjBzn3Y5RBQ.text: We went here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon while running errands. Clean, bright, refreshing atmosphere with photos the owner actually took while in Greece. We met the owner when we had questions on one of menu items, and he was friendly and personable. The food exceeded our expectations and some of the best baklava I have ever had! For real Greek food here in Fort Mill - Greco Fresh Grille is a must!

ZLbSWz9SbbyzRqElV7JtZg.text: The owner is great and super friendly. Most of the food is excellent, and the baklava is great. My only complaints are the lack of healthy options (a lot of fried food) and the Falafel is usually really dry.

3572sjRpQmLV3jYjzlVWwQ.text: First of all, the staff here is amazing! They accommodated our big group nicely.  Food was also good, a nice change for the Fort Mill/Tega Cay area. Will definitely be back :)

2CmD_7U-ApSbWAwrMbhjYQ.text: I am ECSTATIC that Greco has come to Tega Cay!!!! I always have the chicken gyro and lemon oregano fries, and they are fantastic. Love the staff, too! Very genuine, nice people.

6jyq6_xBhvFrEVEOQ4q3FA.text: It's so nice to have Greek food in Ft. Mill. Everything I've tried there is delicious and fresh tasting.  The lamb is excellent, and the fries are good as well. Will certainly be there again.

qdGv-L1LVOmdPXkn3n7o0g.text: Food was okay but it made me appreciate Showmars.  The floors were greasy and they must have poor ventilation - there was a haze in the air and two days later I put my jacket on and it smells like the place.

QvdhlXc6TRPrVMmrPKxZ5g.text: Seriously amazing food!! You won't be disappointed!! I had the shrimp kebabs and my husband had the beef gyro! Let's just say we are both satisfied, and we will definitely be back for more!! Super happy they will have mousaka on the menu next week!! I love me some authentic Greek food!!

vYZTo1iCBDjr5BE5A3UUBw.text: We have ordered take out many times. Their traditional gyros are quite excellent. My daughters like the chicken gyros over the traditional, but both are quite tasty.

Yh34LBFFDKdynqvwFATJhQ.text: Just had our first experience at Greco and the food was to die for! The chicken kabobs, fries, and baklava were delicious. Not to mention the very attentive and kind staff. We will definitely be returning for excellent Mediterranean food.

W-rhaI9ndKa4eEXIe95Kyw.text: Was really excited to see mostly good reviews. But they don't answer phones and apparently they could care less about being open during their posted hours of operation. Even tried going in person to show up to locked doors hours before closing. If you can't actually be open during your own posted hours you should not own a business. Very very verrrrry poorly ran establishment.

m69MWak4cfBesVBVz4DNvg.text: Great food and service.  The falafel pita was flavorful and didn't miss eating meat it was so good.

JYJpu_4Mz5Kc_hD1WapEmQ.text: Epic food.....we ate inside and it was a little smokey from the grill.  If I leave a place and smell like the food that usually means it's awesome.  We will be back.

2tqn4SJcJ-5-YKQwmxUNbA.text: My husband and I love Greek food. We were super impressed with the price and delicious food. We will definitely be back! Love it! The veggie gyro is amazing and my husband loved the chicken gyro. The hummus is superb and the fries were perfect!

nYie9GMKBDQ0QZ5LOBsIwQ.text: One word AMAZING!!! I'm Lebanese and from New Jersey it will be a Year that I'm living here and to have a Greek place right down the street from where I live is a bonus it was my first time there and it won't be the last! They have a decent menu and was so excited to try the hummus which I got a small garlic hummus as a starter and it came with delicious pita bread which was warm and soft just perfect, the hummus was so good next time I go I'm ordering a large one  then for lunch I got the traditional Gyro and words can't describe the party that was going on in my mouth it was so good the spices on the meat was so flavorful the tzatziki sauce was perfect I love extra so next time I'll have them out more on it! I'm a sucker for baklava so you know I had to try it and I so wasn't disappointed it was one of the best I've had in very long time. The owner's of the place couldn't have been any nicer they even took time and sat down with me and my friends who have been there before and it turns out the places they owned in NJ I've been too before such a small world! I'm so glad they came to Fort Mill they definitely have me sold!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Greek Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Absolutely delicious Stuffed grape leaves and a falafel sandwich

SbuOg4Hax0IUGGe8Kf7TyQ.text: The food was nothing to rave about. I had the grilled chicken gyro and it was ok.  A friend ordered the Greek salad that came with one small block of feta cheese and olives that were not pitted. Not impressed, will not be going back.

GPMEUP9dp7bIR1vkwPzqAA.text: This is a brand new establishment be as expected the crowd flood it at least for lunch. It was crowded. They have a number system that you place on your table and a server comes and delivers your food but you pay prior to like you would at a fast food place. The food is mediocre at best for Greek. The fries were over salted and the meat is not bursting with flavor. The value is not there for $11 my platter was not delicious me I would not count on coming back. Staff is friendly but seems overwhelmed.

nfsMJjgf7H729YBHj8N1Yg.text: My wife and I stopped in for lunch today and both were extremely impressed by all aspects of our dining experience. Staff were all friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and offered very informative suggestions where needed.  I had the lamb burger with feta cheese and sea salt fries and my wife had the Greek Salad - both were OUTSTANDING!  The Tzatziki sauce was the best I've ever had.  And you know, when something as basic as Tzatziki sauce (basically a condiment) is noticeably better than all others, it speaks volume of the quality and taste of everything else on the menu.  Greco Fresh Grille is a definite must try!

BzCkE81ZW586UZuHfKIjcQ.text: Saw the Now Open banner yesterday and visited today for lunch.  It is right next to a wonderful deli.  Met the owner, Nick, yesterday and seems like a stand up guy.  Today ordered two traditional Gyros and a side of hummus.  Absolutely delicious!  So nice to have another ehtnic food option in Tega Cay!  You need to try this place.  We will be back many times!

TzmiOgJMZ-3aLToDihwfag.text: Super excited that they opened close to my house.  I work closer to their other location and we always stop by to pick up for dinner.  Now that they are closer we are here for Sunday lunch. Delicious, fresh and authentic food.

U-HjiwNGAZc_5TSzjJxdBg.text: Fast, friendly and delicious. The place is great. The gyros are fresh and this place is becoming my new go to place for Greek food.
